properties.description:
6N-003AW4W45
Sewage overflows into the yard of Juanita Sellers of 241 Brewer St. in Hayneville 36040.

6M-000EY1N88
Complainant stated that there was a recurring SSO problem from the Daehan Solutions Alabama going towards the City of Hayneville WWTP. He stated that this has been going on for 3 years and that the county and the city had been contacted but it appeared that there had not been a permanent fix.

5B-005WF8I51
According to the complaint, on the west side of the Flying J Truck Stop in Hope Hull, there is a large amount of green algae or sewage like substance that appears to be running out of a hole located in the middle of the power company access road. Take I-65 South to Exit 158 (Pintlala Tyson). Turn Right on Tyson Road. The Flying J is located immediately on the left. A power company access road is on the west boundary of the Flying J. The discharge is on the access road, very visible from Tyson Road. Note: There is a sewage lift station about a quarter mile away at the intersection of Tyson Road and County Road 26. NOTE: on 9/30/13, an SSO was received from the town of Hayneville indicating that found that there was a broken section of the sewer line. The line had been repaired. Complaint closed on 9/30/13.

0C-005CU6L26
Ms. Rosa Mickles of 13 Braxton Drive in Hayneville (Lowndes County) contacted the Department to express continuing problems that she has been having with leaking sewage at her residence. She indicated that Hayneville City personnel clean out the system but she continues to have problems with sewage accumulating in her yard.

5Y-003DN6N17
The citizens of Lowndes County located on HWY 97 N between Lowndesboro and Hayneville do not
have sufficient water pressure for safe use due to a road project by the State of Alabama. The
temporary water line which has a diameter of a dime has been placed on top of the ground and
exposed to the general public Since September of 2013. The pressure is not sufficient to safely flush
the water lines or provide the customers adequate pressure. At each creek crossing there is an
exposed water line of approximately dime size. Total length of exposed water line at each crossing is
approximately 1000 feet.; Observed: It has been present since September of 2013. (PLEASE NOTE:
On 6/18/14, Loren Crawford sent me the following e-mails. (1) e-mail #1 from Jeff Williams, Ground
Water Section "Hey Kelvin, Loren is out of the office today and my boss asked me to check on the
attached complaint we received. I spoke with the Town Clerk and she said the contractors are still
working on the line replacement. I’m just guessing that the project is taking much longer than it
normally would due to all of the heavy rain. It was extremely soft when we were there in May and
we’ve probably had foot of rain since then. Anyway, when you have a few minutes would you respond
to this email and just give us a brief status report on the line replacement, creek bores, etcetera.
Thanks and have a good weekend. (2) e-mail #2 from Kevin Lawrence "Jeff the contractor has
finished the road bores, the connections has to be made. They should be complete a week from
today. If you need any further updates just let me know." Thanks. Kevin J Lawrence." Therefore,
based on the e-mails from Loren Crawford, this complaint was closed on 6/19/14.)

Approximate
7N-002DU5C66
There is not sufficient water pressure within Hayneville's water system to safely supply the water customers water along Highway 97 North between Hayneville and Lowndesboro. hayneville is reconnecting a small water line for the customers but there are multiple leaks within the system which are not being repaired. these leaks will allow contamination to enter into the water system; Observed:
since September 2013.

8D-005NS3G81
The Department received a complaint from Mr. Walt Johnson concerning sewage flowing onto his property from the lift staion that serves the Flying J Truck Stop in Hanyeville (Lowndes Co.). According to the complainant, raw sewage is flowing onto his cattle farm located on Lowndes County road 6 adjacent to the Flying "J" truck stop.

8R-002FG6V71
Humberto Guzman with EPA Region 4 referred a complaint concerning a possible sewage issue at
205 Tuskeena St E Rm 101 in Hayneville (Lowndes County). According to the complaint, The
residents of Lowndes County Alabama need a water treatment plant because they are suffering a
large scale hook-worm epidemic which is endemic to their area due to raw sewage. They cannot
afford the two thousand dollar septic tanks, and the ones they have back up into their yards and
homes. They are a population of 10,500, so rural."

2Q-000CH7U16
Ms. Annie Caldwell of 13 Pecan Circle in Hayneville contacted the Department to express concerns
about sewage in her yard. Ms. Caldwell stated that her residence is serviced by septic tank and that it
appears to be working properly. Ms. Caldwell stated that the source might be the Pecan Lane
Apartment Complex that is located up gradient from her residence.

3X-005JB1L06
Ms. Debora Eady contacted the Department to discuss a possible sewage overflow.
According to Ms. Eady a lift station is overflowing sewage in Lowndes County. The location is on Hwy
26, right hand side of the road, a short distance before Judge Road. Ms. Eady also stated that there
has been an ongoing ‘trickle’ of sewage along the roadway resulting from this overflow for many
weeks.

5Y-007GY2Q72
The Department received a complaint concerning issues with drinking water having a strange odor
and taste at the Shady Lake Mobile Home Park. The complainant also stated that there were only
approximately nine mobile homes being served by the trailer park well.

6K-001GS7K37
Mr. John Williams of 101 Commerce Street in Hayneville contacted the Department to express
concerns with a possible leaking sewage field line behind his residence. He indicated that Hayneville
personnel have been pumping the line for about 7 to 8 weeks due to issues with leaking sewage.

6A-003JC4U06
The Department received a complaint concerning issues with drinking water having a "strange" odor and taste at the Shady Lake Mobile Home Park on Shady Lake Drive in Lowndesboro. Its is unclear which water system they are located on. The complainant also stated several of the mobile homes are possibly allowing sewage to pour onto the ground. The complainant is concerned about the possibility of cross contamination. The Lowndes County Health Department will be contacted regarding this matter.

1B-004MU4Q15
Water leak from underground where drain pipe was installed by Town of Mosses during sewer system installation project.; Observed: February, 2015 (PLEASE NOTE: This complaint is a duplicate of Complaint #3S-002UP6X75.
